meanings.definition: Improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
meanings.sent1: She worked hard to refind her painting skills.
meanings.sent2: After some practice, he was able to refind his golf swing.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to refind her masterpiece with a few more brush strokes.
meanings.sent4: With dedication, he was able to refind his passion for music.
meanings.sent5: The chef knew he had to refind the recipe to make the perfect dish.

meanings.definition: To become more elegant or polished in behavior or manners
meanings.sent1: Through etiquette classes, she hoped to refind her social grace.
meanings.sent2: He aimed to refind his manners to impress his date.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter tried to refind his balance while carrying the tray.
meanings.sent4: Her speech coach helped her refind her eloquence for the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The princess needed to refind her royal poise before the ball.

meanings.sent1: He was excited to refind his childhood toy in the attic.
meanings.sent2: She managed to refind the lost key under the sofa.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist hoped to refind the ancient artifact during the dig.
meanings.sent4: After hours of searching, they were able to refind the missing document.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed to refind the clue to solve the case.
